perturbation.changed_text:
9.2.4
ELEPHANT TALK shall pay all invoices no later than 60 Calendar Days after the invoice date. ELEPHANT TALK is entitled to a 5% discount, in the event that ELEPHANT

perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating invoices are due in 60 days, but a discount applies if paid within 30 days. This is contradictory, as the deadline and the incentive are misaligned.

perturbation.original_text:
9.2.8
Invoices not paid within the time limit set down in article 9.2.4 shall bear interest (“enkelvoudig”) on a daily basis at the rate of the legal

Interest shall continue to accrue notwithstanding termination or expiry of this Agreement for any cause whatsoever.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.2.8
Invoices not paid within the time limit set down in article 9.2.4 shall not bear any interest (“enkelvoudig”) on a daily basis at the rate of the legal
commercial interest rate (“wettelijke handelsrente”) plus 1 % until full payment is received by T-Mobile whether before or after judgment.
Interest shall continue to accrue notwithstanding termination or expiry of this Agreement for any cause whatsoever.
perturbation.explanation: This modification contradicts itself by stating invoices not paid within the specified time limit shall *not* bear any interest, even while retaining the original text's specification for how that interest would accrue. This in-text contradiction creates immediate uncertainty regarding the interest policy.
